page.title: 08GRAYS THURROCK CARNIVAL 1985
page.content:
The first Saturday in June was Carnival Day. Our float from Grays South Play Centre was of nationalities of the world. My mum was dressed as a Pearly Queen. She made her own costume. She made mine too. I was a Spanish lady. My dress was black and purple. I had a real Spanish shawl and I wore a rose in my hair. We set off from Kilverts Field at half past two. It seemed a long way to Blackshots. We received a trophy.
{MY CARNIVAL COSTUME} I was dressed as Worzel Gummidge the scarecrow. I had straw in my hat and in my sleeves. My trousers had splits at the bottoms. I had a big nose and a toy bird in my pocket. I carried an umbrella. I looked funny.
